    void run()
    the main thread of the client network handler of the server, associated to a specific client it listens to the client and reads all messages coming from the client then it adds the to the queue using receive method if the connection fails, it performs all the action required to remove the client from the list of virtual clients and terminates the connection

    • hasNextMessage

      public boolean hasNextMessage()
      synchronized method that inspects the queue of messages
      Returns:
      false if the queue is empty, true otherwise

    • send

      public void send​(Message message)
      method that performs all the required actions to send a message to the client

      Parameters:

    • receive

      public void receive​(Message message)
      method used to add a new message from the client to the queue
      Specified by:
      receive in interface NetworkInterface
      Parameters:
      message - the received message

    • checkConnection

      public void checkConnection()
      method used to check the connection server-side: it ping the client every SO_TIMEOUT / 4 milliseconds
      Specified by:
      checkConnection in interface NetworkInterface

    • run

      public void run()
      the main thread of the client network handler of the server, associated to a specific client it listens to the client and reads all messages coming from the client then it adds the to the queue using receive method if the connection fails, it performs all the action required to remove the client from the list of virtual clients and terminates the connection
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class java.lang.Thread
      See Also:
      Thread.run()
